title: What are some eerie rock songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think the song “Rhythm of the Heat” by Peter Gabriel can be eerie, especially if you know the inspiration for the song. Gabriel was inspired to write this song after reading “Symbols And The Interpretation of Dreams” by Carl Jung. Jung was writing about the collective unconscious and describes being embedded with tribal drummers and dancers in Africa. Jung was so entranced by the music and movement he began to fear that he was losing his mind. Gabriel perfectly captures his fear and paranoia especially at the end of the song when he employs strong tribal drumbeats and a Ghanaian war dance with these ominous heavy thuds. I watched a video of Gabriel and his band performing this song at the first WOMAD show (see video at end of this answer). When the drums kick in he has these amazing African drummers and dancers join him on stage. He starts to get entranced, falls to his knees and begins to writhe, eyes rolling to the back of his head, as he slowly leans back and becomes possessed with this maelstrom of sound and emotion. Wow!! What a breath taking performance! Here are the lyrics and song. I hope you enjoy!
